lines.text: [Nita helps rescue Prince Roland from an ambush by men masquerading as French soldiers]
What are you doing here?
More importantly, what are they doing here?
Why didn't you take her home?
Why aren't all tigers behind bars?
Welcome to Fort Bleak!
At first sight, I would have preferred England.
His Majesty, King Stephan of Haagen.
On second sight, Fort Bleak is looking better.

[to Jan]
Wait till she gets her third sight - when he throws her in the dungeon.
You're not returning to that bedroom are you?
Why not? The night is young.
But Princess Maria isn't.
Nothing you say will alter the fact that I am married to an imposter for life.
His death will annul your marriage.
[Prince Roland's capture of the Spanish supply ships are not without casualties]
We grow smaller with each victory.
Another headache?
Yes, I have.
What am I going to marry - a woman or a headache!
You majesty, we've found Prince Roland's hideout. I've sent enough soldiers to make sure of his capture this time.
I want more than his capture. Have horses saddled for us.
Yes, your majesty.

[to Princess Maria]
I am personally going to remove the cause of your headaches.
It seems you have been causing you *wife* an unaccountable number of headaches. Hasn't he, darling?
Your brother seems to think I enjoyed your little treachery.
The greatest treachery, madam, was fate's interfering hand.
[last lines]
As commandant of the palace, I wish to report that the French army is prepared to leave. Your majesty? Your majesty? Your majesty?
[Roland and Nita are kissing passionately]
What am I supposed to do now?
In France, we honor such moments with *silence*.
